required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Initial Positioning of Left Sided Double Lumen Endobronchial Tubes Using Peak Inspiratory Pressures Difference Between Two Lungs
clinical_study.official_title: Initial Positioning of Left Sided Double Lumen Endobronchial Tubes Using Peak Inspiratory Pressures Difference Between Two Lungs

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate a performance of initial positioning of left sided double lumen endobronchial tubes using peak inspiratory pressures difference between two lungs.

detailed_description.textblock: If both lungs have relatively equal volumes and the double lumen tube is in a satisfactory position, peak inspiratory pressure between two lungs is similar or equal when each lumen is sequentially clamped while ventilating each lung with the same tidal volume. We are going to investigate a performance of this method by fiberoptic bronchoscopy view and depth of double lumen tube, and compare with an conventional auscultation method.

primary_outcome.description: aucsultation under manual ventilation -> fiberopric bronchoscopy view check peak inspiratory pressure difference under mechanical ventilation -> fiberoptic bronchoscopy view check

secondary_outcome.description: aucsultation under manual ventilation -> A depth of DLT (incisor) peak inspiratory pressure difference under mechanical ventilation -> A depth of DLT (incisor)

arm_group.description: Peak inspiratory pressures difference between two lungs

intervention.description: Peak inspiratory pressures difference between two lungs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA physical status class I, II
- Use of double lumen tube
- Normal preoperative pulmonary function study
Exclusion Criteria:
- COPD
- Restrictive lung disease
- CAOD
- Unstable hemodynamic status
- Peak inspiratory pressure > 30 mm Hg (Two lung ventilation)

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine , Anesthesia and Pain Research Institute, Yonsei University College of Medicine
